NOTE: Given any matix A∈Mn×n(F)A \in M_{n \times n}(\mathbb{F})A∈Mn×n​(F)﻿, we will seek vectors x⃗\vec{x} x﻿ such that Ax⃗A\vec{x}Ax﻿ is a scalar multiple of x⃗\vec{x}x﻿. Characteristic Polynomial and Eigenvalues

Definition: Eigenvalue Equation or Eigenvalue Problem

Let A∈Mn×n(F)A\in M_{n \times n}(\mathbb{F})A∈Mn×n​(F)﻿, we refer to the equation

or

as the eigenvalue equation for the matrix AAA﻿ over F\mathbb{F}F﻿. It is also sometimes refered to as the eigenvalue problem.

NOTE: This is an unusual equation to solve since we want to solve it for both the vector x⃗∈Fn\vec{x} \in \mathbb{F}^nx∈Fn﻿ and the scalaer λ∈F\lambda \in \mathbb{F}λ∈F﻿. We will approach the problem by first identifying eligible values of λ\lambda λ﻿. We can then determine corresponding sets of vectors x⃗\vec{x}x﻿ that solve the equation for each λ\lambda λ﻿ we identify. As mentioned in the previous note, a trivial solution to this equation is x⃗=0⃗\vec{x} = \vec{0}x=0﻿. We try to obtain a non-trivial (x⃗≠0⃗)(\vec{x} \ne \vec{0})(x=0)﻿ solution to the eigenvalue equation. This is possible if and only if the RREF of matrix A−λIA - \lambda IA−λI﻿ has fewer than nn n﻿ pivots, which occurs if and only if it is not invertible, i.e, det⁡(A−λI)=0\det(A - \lambda I) = 0det(A−λI)=0﻿. Computing det⁡(A−λI)=det⁡[a11−λa12…a1na21a22−λ…a2n⋮⋮⋱⋮an1an2…ann−λ]\det(A - \lambda I) = \det \begin{bmatrix} a_{11} - \lambda & a_{12} & \dots & a_{1n}\\ a_{21} & a_{22} - \lambda & \dots & a_{2n}\\ \vdots & \vdots & \ddots & \vdots \\ a_{n1} & a_{n2} & \dots & a_{nn} - \lambda \end{bmatrix}det(A−λI)=det⎣⎡​a11​−λa21​⋮an1​​a12​a22​−λ⋮an2​​……⋱…​a1n​a2n​⋮ann​−λ​⎦⎤​﻿ by expanding along the first row, we sum up nn n﻿ terms, each of which is the product of entries in A−λIA - \lambda IA−λI﻿. Since each entry is either a constant or a linear term in a variable λ\lambda λ﻿, and all the products present in the expanded determinant calculation contains nnn﻿ terms, we can infer that det⁡(A−λI)\det(A - \lambda I)det(A−λI)﻿ is a polynomila in λ\lambda λ﻿ of degree nnn﻿.

Diagonalization of Linear Operators

Definition: Eigenveector, Eigenvalues and Eigenpair of a Linear Operator

Let T:Fn→FnT: \mathbb{F}^n \to \mathbb{F}^nT:Fn→Fn﻿ be a linear operator. We say that the non-zero vector x⃗∈Fn\vec{x}\in \mathbb{F}^nx∈Fn﻿ is an eigenvector of TTT﻿ to mean that there exists a scalar λ∈F\lambda \in \mathbb{F}λ∈F﻿ such that

This equation is called the eigenvalue equation or the eigenvalue problem. The scalar λ\lambdaλ﻿ is called the eigenvalue of TTT﻿ and the pair (λ,x⃗)(\lambda, \vec{x})(λ,x)﻿ is called the eigenpair of TTT﻿.

Proposition: Eigenpairs of TTT﻿ and [T]B[T]_\mathcal{B}[T]B​﻿

Let T:Fn→FnT: \mathbb{F}^n \to \mathbb{F}^nT:Fn→Fn﻿ be a linear operator and let B\mathcal{B}B﻿ be an ordered basis of Fn\mathbb{F}^nFn﻿. This proposition shows that solving the eigenvalue problem for a linear operator is equaivalent to solving the eigenvalue problem of a matrix.

Definition: Diagonalizable

Let T:Fn→FnT: \mathbb{F}^n \to \mathbb{F}^nT:Fn→Fn﻿ be a linear operator. We say that TTT﻿ is diagonalizable over F\mathbb{F}F﻿ if there exists an ordered basis of B\mathcal{B}B﻿ of Fn\mathbb{F}^nFn﻿ such that [T]B[T]_\mathcal{B}[T]B​﻿ is a diagonal matrix.

Corollary: Eigenvector Basis Criterion for Diagonalizability – Matrix Version

Let A∈Mn×n(F)A \in M_{n \times n}(\mathbb{F})A∈Mn×n​(F)﻿. Then AAA﻿ is diagonalizable over F\mathbb{F}F﻿ if and only if there exists a basis of Fn\mathbb{F}^nFn﻿ consisting of eigenvectors of AAA﻿.

Proof:

Consider the linear operator TA:Fn→FnT_A: \mathbb{F}^n \to \mathbb{F}^nTA​:Fn→Fn﻿ such that TA(x⃗)=Ax⃗T_A(\vec{x}) = A \vec{x}TA​(x)=Ax﻿. Then [TA]E=A[T_A]_\mathcal{E} = A[TA​]E​=A﻿ and

AA A﻿ is diagonalizable over F\mathbb{F}F﻿

⟺[TA]E\Longleftrightarrow [T_A]_\mathcal{E}⟺[TA​]E​﻿ is diagonalizable over F\mathbb{F}F﻿ by TT T﻿ is diagonalizable iff [T]B[T]_\mathcal{B} [T]B​﻿ Diagonalizable proposition.

⟺TA\Longleftrightarrow T_A⟺TA​﻿ is diagonalizable over F\mathbb{F}F﻿ by Eigenvector Basis Criterion for Diagonalizability proposition.

⟺\Longleftrightarrow⟺﻿ There exists a basis B\mathcal{B}B﻿ of Fn\mathbb{F}^nFn﻿ of eigenvectors of TAT_ATA​﻿ by Eigenvector Basis Criterion for Diagonalizability proposition.

By Eigenpairs of TTT﻿ and [T]B[T]_\mathcal{B}[T]B​﻿ proposition, x⃗\vec{x}x﻿ is an eigenvector of TAT_ATA​﻿ if and only if x⃗\vec{x}x﻿ is an eigenvector of [T]E=A[T]_\mathcal{E} = A[T]E​=A﻿. Therefore, there exists a basis B\mathcal{B}B﻿ of Fn\mathbb{F}^nFn﻿ of eigenvectors of TAT_ATA​﻿ if and only if there exists a basis B\mathcal{B}B﻿ of Fn\mathbb{F}^nFn﻿ of eigenvectors of AAA﻿.

QED■^\blacksquare■﻿
